Each kingdom has its own economy, a capi: Each kingdom has its own economy, a capital, and every turn, it earns as much money as there are hexes inside.

Your capital stores your kingdom's money: Your capital stores your kingdom's money and provides protection for adjacents hexes.

If you by capturing a hex make two of yo: If you by capturing a hex make two of your kingdoms share a border, they will merge to form a single stronger one.

Also, if a kingdom is cut by a unit, the: Also, if a kingdom is cut by a unit, the economy is split depending on the size of the split up kingdoms.
This is a key to the game: try to merge: This is a key to the game: try to merge your kingdoms to stronger ones and cut your opponent kingdoms to divide his forces.
If you don't have enough money to pay ma: If you don't have enough money to pay maintenance for your units, they'll all die!
At the beginning of a turn, your kingdom: At the beginning of a turn, your kingdoms earn one gold for each hex it owns. Then you pay your unit maintenance.

All units of your kingdom die and the ec: All units of your kingdom die and the economy is reset to zero.
You have to wait for the next turn to ea: You have to wait for the next turn to earn money, but you can still play your other kingdoms: the bankruptcy affects only one kingdoms.

A unit belongs to its kingdom, cannot be: A unit belongs to its kingdom, cannot be transfered to another kingdom and can not be sold.
A unit also has a maintenance cost every: A unit also has a maintenance cost every turn, so keep an eye on your kingdom's balance.
Each unit can move freely inside its kin: Each unit can move freely inside its kingdom. But a unit can only do one action per turn.
To move a unit, you simply click on it t: To move a unit, you simply click on it to select it. Then you can click on the hex you want to put the unit on.
Once a unit has made its action, it cann: Once a unit has made its action, it cannot be moved anymore, stops bouncing and stays on the hex until the next turn.
Moving only inside kingdom is not consid: Moving only inside kingdom is not considered an action, so you can move it until the unit has made an action.
You have to capture all hexes of the wor: You have to capture all hexes of the world to win, but your opponents might surrender before that.
You can only capture hexes adjacents to: You can only capture hexes adjacents to your kingdom. The captured hex will become part of your kingdom.

It defends them at the same level as the: It defends them at the same level as the unit's level, and only hexes in its own kingdom.
This level 1 unit defend all adjacent he: This level 1 unit defend all adjacent hexes at level 1. Only level 2 enemy units can capture them and kill your unit.

your unit has a higher level than the en: your unit has a higher level than the enemy unit,

Keep an eye on the hexes you are defendi: Keep an eye on the hexes you are defending with your unit placement at the end of the turn. You may want to defend your frontiers.
Level 1 and 2 units do their best here d: Level 1 and 2 units do their best here defending the borders, but be aware of your critical points where the enemy can divide your kingdom easily.
Level 1 units are good for providing a l: Level 1 units are good for providing a low cost, wide and basic kingdom protection.
But as the enemy builds units, you have: But as the enemy builds units, you have to upgrade your units to be able to defend your kingdom from a stronger enemy.
To upgrade a unit, you simply merge two: To upgrade a unit, you simply merge two units together by placing one unit on another. This creates a single stronger unit that can beat stronger enemy units and structures.
Upgrade units by taking one and placing: Upgrade units by taking one and placing it on another.
The newly created unit can only make an: The newly created unit can only make an action if you merged two units that could make an action (so try to merge two units that haven't already made their actions).
You can also upgrade a unit by selecting: You can also upgrade a unit by selecting it and buy a new unit. This will simply upgrade the selected unit.
Each unit costs 10 gold to buy and costs: Each unit costs 10 gold to buy and costs 10 gold to upgrade.
A level 1 unit costs 2 gold every turn t: A level 1 unit costs 2 gold every turn to maintain.
And the maintenance cost is tripled each: And the maintenance cost is tripled each level the unit upgrades.

There are two types of trees: the coasta: There are two types of trees: the coastal tree and the continental tree.
Coastal trees grows only on world edges: Coastal trees grows only on world edges and they spread quickly.
Continental trees grow everywhere else,: Continental trees grow everywhere else, but don't spread as quickly.
Upgraded units costs a lot of money each: Upgraded units costs a lot of money each turn, so you should only upgrade your level 1 unit if you already have a few other level 1 units or have at least six hexes in your kingdom.
Upgrading your level 2 unit to level 3 i: Upgrading your level 2 unit to level 3 is seldom necessary. Do it only if you already have many level 2 units and a stable kingdom, or if your opponent has built many towers.
Level 4 units are for very late games, w: Level 4 units are for very late games, when you have almost conquered the entire world and need to kill a level 3 opponent unit.
It is usually easiest to kill level 3 or: It is usually easiest to kill level 3 or level 4 opponent units by cutting his territory, thus reducing the opponent kingdom's income.
